1.content:
Well, you've been sold off. Apparently, you were such a good worker from where you're from, you attracted the attention of some very rich farms. So, your old farm decided to sell you off when offered a generous sum of money. So, now you're on a truck, being carried off to this new farm. Though, before you reach it, a few questions need to be answered.

First, are these feral animals, or anthro animals?
1.title: The First Day of the Rest of Your Life

11.content: So, this is a world with anthro animals. That means being able to walk around like a person. Now, mister, what kind of animal-person do you think you are?
11.title: Anthro

choices: Introduce yourself to the main house
111.content:
You were a very tough horse, especially for your size! Next to a grown adult, you'd measure up to their hips. Despite this, you're known to run for 3 hours a time, capable of lifting someone twice your size! Who knows how much you can lift when you're fully grown! Guess the new farm is gonna find out (hopefully). You're a chocolate brown horse with a darker muzzle. You felt extremely nervous about going out here, but your old barn-mates assured you this'd be for the best. If they spent as much as they had on you, then they must've bought you with the full intention of doing everything to keep you up to snuff!

Soon, you felt the truck stop. Then, light poured in as the back the truck opened up, allowing you safe passage out. You gently stepped out, and walked around. You were hit with the smell of the farm. It was sort of familiar to you, having lived on one since you were born, and yet this smell was alien to you. You felt the urge to cover your nose as you stepped towards the white house in front of the truck, surely the living space of the farm owner. You see your previous owner speaking with the new owner, them bearing white and gray hair respectively, overalls you'd see on a stereotypical farmer, and a red and blue tweed shirt respectively.

The two of them were shaking hands, and nodded to each other. Then, your owner stepped away from him, and back towards his truck. As he passed by, he brought up a hand and gently ruffled the top of your head. "Good luck, bud," he said as he stepped back into his truck. Then, you watched as it reversed out of the driveway, onto the road, and away, and you were still trying to digest the idea that that'd be the last you'd see of him. Meanwhile, the new owner stepped up behind you.

"Welcome to my farm!" he declared to you. "I'm Mr. Sybill! I'm gonna feed and groom you each day, and you just have to play nice with your fellow animals. If somethin' is starting to go south, feel free to speak to me." He spoke like a friendly old grandpa, immediately trying to get you more acquainted with your new home. "My down the path by my house. I can lead you there if you wish."

"N-no thanks, I think I can follow it on my own," you said. Sybill shrugged, and walked towards his house. Then, you began to go down the path he described. As you walked down, you began to see a barn just like any other, red and white with a great big silo on one side. Next to it were several pens, and you could see other animals within them. You could also see some stables near the barn, which naturally drew you towards it. Though, wouldn't it get kinda boring talking to more horses again?

Before you could consider that further, the form of a cow suddenly filled your sights. Just like you, she was standing upright. She appeared to be a grownup, explaining why you measured up to her navel. She was white with black spots, and seemed to bear an hourglass figure. Like any other cow, her breasts were big, supporting quite a bit of milk. You remembered the cows at your old farm, but your old owner didn't like the animals mingling, so you didn't often get to speak with the cows. Good for you, considering how they usually boasted a form that made you feel funny.

"You must be the new guy, right?" she said. You felt too nervous to speak, with her voluptuous form standing so close to you. Though, you were able to muster up a nod. "Our leader, Ms. Bessy, likes to greet all the new guys. She's a bit busy with some cuties right now, buuuut..." She reached behind her, before pulling out a spotted washcloth. She handed it to you, and you nervously picked it up. "Go in the barn, and you'll see a line. As long as you brandish this to them, you'll be able to skip the line and see Ms. Bessy."

"O...ok," you said, a little nervous. You were surprised someone greeted you this fast, and that apparently they wanted you to see this Ms. Bessy. You curiously looked at the spotted washcloth, and in that time, the cow you spoke to walked away, leaving you confused about this. Though, as she left, she let out a "Welcome to the barn."

Now, you could greet anyone you wished to at first. First was the barn, which this Ms. Bessy apparently was staying at. Second was the stable, where you could get familiar with the local horses. Then there are the pens, which, even from here, you could see the pigs within. There were more buildings near the barn, though you couldn't see them from here. Maybe you could check them out later.

"Hello, dear~" he said. "Hey, you don't look like anyone I've seen before... Are you the new guy?"

"You shy, bud?" he asked, coming in from behind, leaning against the back of the couch. His hands came down and gently stroked the top of your head, which made you feel weirder, which he seemed to notice. "Ah, somebody touch you in a funny way, little guy?" he asked, peering between your legs.

"Sybill had a family here, but the ma lost interest in the farm business, so she left and took the son with her," he said. "Ah, here they are!" At that, you perked up and stepped over, seeing him pull up a pair of green shorts. They looked like they'd be fine for a normal kid, but they were kinda small for you. Still, if this'd help...

1112.content:
You decided the most logical step was to check out the stables. You figured that, you being a horse, it'd be very simple for you to get familiar with the horses in the farm. After all, you'd likely be living with them for a while. So, you began progressing to the stables. You walked in, and were greeted with a fairly familiar sight, at least upon first look. The stables looked just like your old place, with several stalls around the place intent for horses. You also saw several leather harnesses around the stables, which was weird. They sort of looked like they were intent on covering the whole of a person. It also stunk a little. It kind of reminded you of how smelly it was at your old place, but considering you got used to it over there, you felt like you'd get used to it here.

Then, you heard a yawn come from one of the stalls. You looked towards it, and saw a horse rise from it. She bore a sylphlike face, and had droopy eyes, still trying to fight off Mr. Sandman.

"Yaaaaawn... Oh, I haven't seen you here before..." the horse said. By their tone, you figured they were female, an assumption that was made clear when she brought herself up higher, bringing her breasts up over the stall and in front of you. She was as naked as any other mare you met, and slightly taller than the tallest mare you remembered. And yet she seemed fairly sleepy. "You must be, yaaaaawn, the new guy, right?" At that, you nodded, trying to keep your eyes away from her ample chest. Sure, the horses you met were always naked, but they usually found some way to cover up around you. She grinned. "Well, nice to make your acquaintance... We apologize, but it's a bit of a tight fit around here..."

"Indeed it is," you heard a more masculine voice say. You turned towards it, spying the stall next to the sleepy mare. He definitely looked like a stallion, and a mighty one at that. You could see mighty muscles forming his abs, pecs, and his humongous biceps. He looked like a powerful horse, more powerful than many of the horses you knew at the old place. "Unfortunately, we don't have a free stall here. There are more deeper in, but they each have a horse associated with them. If you wish, you can bunk with one of us." At that, you realized the size difference. Your ears would barely poke over the edge of the stall, and they appeared more than chest high over them, at least. If what they said was true...

You never had to bunk with anyone you knew. A good thing too. That usually meant you wouldn't have to be too close to your naked comrades. But if you had to be close to any of these guys... You shook your head, and realized you had to make a choice. Where would you sleep?

1113.content:
You decided to check out the pen. You knew you had to get used to the smell eventually, and what better way to do that than by getting to know the, at least from experience, smelliest animals on the farm. So, you began to approach it, trying desperately to ignore the smell as you got closer. Unfortunately, that'd be a tall order for the strongest of men, and you are far from the strongest. Eventually, you were forced to bring up a hand and cover your nose as you got closer and closer.

Eventually, you were right at the fencing surrounding the pen, and there, you could see that the floor was absolutely caked with mud. Additionally, scattered around the mud field were pigs of various sizes, but even the smallest one was significantly larger than you, your small form being only slightly bigger than her gut. In general, the pigs each seemed to be fairly big and pudgy, and appeared to've covered themselves in mud. Each pig had hips wider than your shoulder span, and the lady pigs generally had breasts larger than your head, while the man pigs were, predictably, flat chested. Well, flatter than the ladies.

Another thing you noticed while looking over them: they reeked! You remembered the pigs back home were rarely bathed, but this was just rediculous! You were forced to fan the air in front of you away. You felt like you should speak up, but soon, the pigs turned towards you, and each of them seemed interested in you. It's not often there's a new face on the barn, it seems. Soon, one of them was up in front of you, her leaning up against the fencing. You could hear it creak under her as she leaned against it.

"Oh, you must be the new guy!" the pig said. She was easily 4 times your size, and stunk like a dumpster. "We heard the new guy was coming today, but no one said he'd be as cute as you are!" You felt your cheeks burn up at that compliment. You wanted to thank her, but the fear of the smell entering your mouth made you seal your lips. Though, thankfully, the look on your face seemed to communicate that you were thankful for her saying that.

"Oh, I'd love to get to know you more!" she said, giddy at the prospect of learning about you. "Come on in! I'm not the only gal that wants to talk to you!" At that, you felt fear. You didn't want to avoid talking to them, you really didn't. But getting in that pen would mean possibly surrounding yourself with their foul smells! Then again, not meeting them would make you look awfully rude, wouldn't it? What to do, what to do...?

1114.content:
You decided that you'd be better acquainted with introducing yourself to the main house for now. Sure, you weren't exactly a house animal, but you felt you should make yourself more comfortable with your owners first. Maybe then the rest of the animals won't seem as intimidating to your nervous mind. So, you turned around, and headed back to the main house.

Back there, you could see that the man that drove you here was already gone. It didn't quite hit you on the way over, the permanence of this. But seeing that empty driveway reminded you all the same: this was your home now, like it or not. All you can do now is say goodbye to the people you knew, though from a distance. You sighed, and turned towards the quaint looking house.

The house seemed to be two floors tall, the outside painted white and the backyard lined with a white picket fence. It seemed fairly unremarkable, though you felt it might grow on you the longer you stayed here. You approached the front door, and, after a few moments of hesitation, you knocked.

"Coming~" you heard from within. You also heard the soft pats of someone walking towards the door, before the door was opened up. And beyond that door, you saw a feminine cat, standing upright. They appeared to be slightly shorter than you, though cats tended to be short, especially compared against horses. They seemed somewhat mature, given the wide hips and the plump cheeks. Though, you couldn't see any breasts. They had white fur with orange spots, and they sported a welcoming grin.

"H-hello, ma'am," you said. At that, the cat's grin seemed to turn more teasing.

"Sorry to dissapoint, kid, but I'm a dude," he said. At that, you felt your cheeks turn red.

"I'm sorry, sir, i-it's just-" you began, only for him to laugh.

"Don't worry, I get that all the time," he said. "Come in, you're the new guy, right?" He stepped aside and motioned you inwards, and you followed. You stepped inside, and were greeted with a very nice smelling home, a few candles placed carefully around, a tasteful rug in the front room, and a couch covered in a shade of blue you felt nostalgic for for some reason. He sat on one side of the couch, and he patted to the one next to him. So, you followed.

Upon sitting down, you heard some claws clatter against the floor upstairs. And that was followed by some frantic running as the claws scraped across the floor, the owner racing out of one of the upstairs rooms and down the stairs. Then, coming skidding into the living room, was a muscular lady dog, sporting thick muscles and a flat chest, though despite being a dog she seemed significantly taller than you.

"New guy!" she shouted out as she scampered over to the couch. Before you could protest her approach, she was suddenly on top of you, stradling your lap and cuddling your face against her chest, causing you to squirm about on the couch as she smooshed you.

"Settle down, Rivet," the cat said. At that, the dog bashfully backed away from you, before sitting down on the cushion between you and the cat. "Well, you got acquainted with Sybill's dog it seems." He sounded teasing in tone. "Meanwhile, my name is Loki. Sybill's gone out to town for a moment, so you got us to take care of you~" You looked up at them both, Rivet's face seeming excited and Loki's face seeming more playful. "If you'd like one of us to show you around, just say so."

You were hit with the smell of the farm. It was sort of familiar to you, having lived on one since you were born, and yet this smell was alien to you. You felt the urge to cover your nose as you stepped towards the white house in front of the truck, surely the living space of the farm owner. You see your previous owner speaking with the new owner, them bearing white and gray hair respectively, overalls you'd see on a stereotypical farmer, and a red and blue tweed shirt respectively.

The two of them were shaking hands, and nodded to each other. Then, your owner stepped away from him, and back towards his truck. As he passed by, he brought up a hand and gently ruffled the top of your head. "Good luck, bud," he said as he stepped back into his truck. Then, you watched as it reversed out of the driveway, onto the road, and away, and you were still trying to digest the idea that that'd be the last you'd see of him. Meanwhile, the new owner stepped up behind you.

"Welcome to my farm!" he declared to you. "I'm Mr. Sybill! I'm gonna feed and groom you each day, and you just have to play nice with your fellow animals. If somethin' is starting to go south, feel free to speak to me." He spoke like a friendly old grandpa, immediately trying to get you more acquainted with your new home. "My down the path by my house. I can lead you there if you wish."

"N-no thanks, I think I can follow it on my own," you said. Sybill shrugged, and walked towards his house. Then, you began to go down the path he described. As you walked down, you began to see a barn just like any other, red and white with a great big silo on one side. Next to it were several pens, and you could see other animals within them. You could also see some stables near the barn, which naturally drew you towards it. Though, wouldn't it get kinda boring talking to more horses again?

Now, you remembered on your way over the person driving you said that, due to being human-ish, that you'd likely have to help with the farm, what with milking, feeding, grooming, etc. You sort of thought about getting a head start on that, but you didn't want to do something without experience. So, you'd probably have to wait for Sybil to tell you about it. Though, if you'd tend to these animals, maybe you should get to know them. Some may wonder what there is to know about a feral animal, but, being an animal, you knew what they wanted.

Now, who should you check out?
141.title: Horse

info.brief_description: As a barn animal, you were transferred to this farm. Though, it's very... strange to you.
info.description:
Welcome to the Farm of Fooling. Here, you play as an animal that's being transferred from one farm to another. You're a fairly young animal, and you're very nervous about your new life. Though, as you're let in on your new farm, you begin to realize you have so much more reason to be nervous. Will you survive the lewd antics of your new barn-mates, or will their fun prove to be too much for you?

Encouraged:
-Domaination
-Vore
-Facesitting
-Farting
-Licking

Rules:
1. Don't be too graphic. Refrain from gory descriptions
2. Digestion, while not explicitly encouraged, is still allowed. Just don't be so detailed with it.
3. None of the barn-mates can be younger than our main character.
4. Keep the Fooling between animals
5. Make sure the main character at least starts out as male
